person_analysis.overview: Gabriel Thompson is a **University of Toronto CS undergrad (2023–2027)** and aspiring software engineer with strong experience in **full-stack web development, infra, and applied AI**. He is the **first SWE intern at an Elad Gil-backed stealth startup**, where he has delivered scalable systems for enterprise clients. He previously worked at **Snorkle Labs**, where his GPT-4 medical presentation feature was cited in NIH funding reviews. At UofT, he served as **CSSU Web Dev Lead**, leading a team of 14, and as **UTMIST Technical Writer**, publishing research summaries. He is also active in teaching, volunteering at **Stuyvesant CS Dojo**. Gabriel blends technical rigor with leadership, writing, and teaching experience.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Gabriel Thompson is a **UofT Computer Science student (2023–2027)** and SWE Intern at a **stealth startup backed by Elad Gil**. He has delivered impactful systems at early-stage startups, contributed to research (Wikipron, UTMIST), and led teams at CSSU. His projects span infra, NLP, AI applications in healthcare, and event platforms, showcasing strong full-stack and data pipeline skills.
